website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for men who want a handsome hiking boot with excellent ankle support.
pros: Recognized for its lightweight yet durable construction, these boots are a favorite for backpacking trips
Buyers admire the impressive and stylish design of these boots
A great choice for men with slim feet
cons: Fit is not true to size
customers should buy at least a half size larger than their normal wear

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Nice Hiking boot, They have to break in for about up to a week, but they are comfortable and rugged. I read the reviews and ordered a 1/2 size larger but could have gone a full size for use with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N

customer_reviews.title: They fit great, and give my ankles the support neede
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of OBOZ. They fit great, and give my ankles the support neede.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Oboz men's Beartooth BDry Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit for a slim foot. Good grip on all types of surface. Snug and warm, feels very solid but flexible at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Crouch

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Lowa Men's Baffin Pro Backpacking Boot,Chestnut/Anthracite,9.5 M US is a good comparison boot to theOboz Men's Beartooth BDRY Hiking Boot,Midnight,10 to the built ,Ive tried the correct size and found that it runs one full size small and a bit narrow from most heavy hiking boots,best of luck with your boots ,they are very nice boots ( if you were a 9 you will want to get a 10 ,at least for me, it fits the best).
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: ... per day and the fit and support are the best I've experienced
customer_reviews.text: I'm still breaking them in 2-3 miles per day and the fit and support are the best I've experienced. (The right side is a little snug but I never had both feet of the same size so I keep the toenails trimmed and they feel great. ) Laces lock your foot in well and I'm walking lawns morning dew every day in the northeast and they are waterproof. Tread is sure footed, glad I own a pair
customer_reviews.author: treemd

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair!
customer_reviews.text: I wear them as my everyday "shoes" and they stay very comfortable throughout their life. My last pair where retired to backyard work as the tread wore down but the boot stitching stayed in place.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Strap mount is a failure
customer_reviews.text: I initially like this boot; in fact I bought a second pair. After some time in the field and well under a year of moderate use the strap mount pulled apart at the ankle. As another reviewer stated, this left the boot nearly worthless and it is a fatal flaw in the design.
customer_reviews.author: John McQuilkin

customer_reviews.title: ... break in time not that long naughty feel very comfortable these boots will last you at least 5 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Mytopo Beartooth boot fits as expected true to size well-constructed boots it takes a little break in time not that long naughty feel very comfortable these boots will last you at least 5 years These Boots are good for hiking construction work everyday walking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: maddigged digs these boots
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about these boots,five star all the way. Defiantly recommend these to anyone who is looking for a great pair of boots
customer_reviews.author: maddigger

customer_reviews.title: Best fit, I brought five pair over four years ...
customer_reviews.text: Best fit, I brought five pair over four years all at a substantial discounts ($100ea or less). I got 1300 miles on the first pair, still use them around the yard. I do use my own insoles. They are heavy and bulky. I weight 200+ .The lacing mechanism is iffy actually broken on me, I still brought three more. They are that comfortable. Never had a blister. I average 700+ miles a year. I use them for everyday wear, yard work, greenways, Heading for Mt Massive this summer.
customer_reviews.author: WJL

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best boot I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best boot I have ever owned. I have had Salomons, Chippewas, Hi-Tecs, Bates, Double H, Red Wings, Asolos, all kinds of combat boots, Salweas, Justins, and a few more I can't think of. These fit me perfectly, give outstanding support, and the waterproofing is great. I am at the emd of my second pair with all kinds of backpacking, daily use, and hard construction work miles on both pairs. I have had laces break, but never any part of the boot itself. If I could,I would but fifteen or twenty pairs to make sure I will always have some.
customer_reviews.author: Benton O. Addison

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these in Zion for hiking. Took a little to break in as expected but once broken in they are the most comfortable boot I've owned. Would definetly purchase another pair.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Oboz Men's Beartooth BDRY Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: GREAT pair of hiking boots. They do take some time to break-in but worth the time spent. Great traction and stability.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Will Never Buy OBOZ Again
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because they appeared to be of quality. Leather that holds the boot lace on the lower ankle portion of the boot ripped halfway after ONE backpacking trip ~16 miles. Thankfully I was not stuck with this garbage as I ordered just before the trip. Save $200 and spend $50-100 more for a durable pair with similar features.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Williams

product_meta.title: Oboz Men's Beartooth BDRY Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Oboz Footwear is owned and operated by a small group of passionate industry veterans and life-long outdoor enthusiasts. They define themselves by where they live and recreate. Their name comes from "outside Bozeman." Their home base, Bozeman, Montana sits on the northern edge of the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem--18 million acres of some of the wildest land in North America. It is here, in the Northern Rocky Mountains, from the Wind River and Teton Ranges to the Bridgers and Spanish Peaks, with incredibly varied geologic features, and abundant wildlife such as grizzly bears, wolves, bison, that Oboz is found. They've adopted the phrase "True to the Trail" as their guiding principle. As a new company, they're faced with direction-changing decisions every day. Filtering all of their decisions through the "True to the Trail" test helps them stay consistent with the vision that led them to create Oboz Footwear.
